name: Discovery of the Philippines by Ferdinand Magellan
description: Ferdinand Magellan arrived in the Philippines, marking the beginning of Spanish colonization.

name: The Katipunan is Founded
description: Andrés Bonifacio founded the Katipunan, a secret revolutionary society aimed at gaining independence from Spanish rule.

name: Declaration of Philippine Independence
description: Emilio Aguinaldo declared the independence of the Philippines from Spain in Kawit, Cavite.

name: Treaty of Paris
description: Spain ceded the Philippines to the United States as part of the Treaty of Paris, ending the Spanish-American War.

name: The First Philippine Republic
description: The First Philippine Republic was inaugurated, with Emilio Aguinaldo as its president.

name: Philippine-American War
description: The war between Filipino revolutionaries and the United States, following the U.S. annexation of the Philippines.

name: Tydings–McDuffie Act
description: The Tydings–McDuffie Act was signed, setting the Philippines on a path to independence after a ten-year transition period.

name: Japanese Occupation of the Philippines
description: The Japanese occupied the Philippines during World War II, leading to widespread resistance and suffering.

name: Philippine Independence from the U.S.
description: The Philippines officially gained independence from the United States, ending nearly 50 years of colonial rule.

name: Declaration of Martial Law
description: President Ferdinand Marcos Sr. declared Martial Law, which lasted until 1981, marking a period of authoritarian rule.

name: Assassination of Benigno Aquino Jr.
description: The assassination of opposition leader Benigno Aquino Jr. on his return to the Philippines sparked widespread protests against Marcos.

name: People Power Revolution
description: A peaceful revolution that led to the ousting of President Ferdinand Marcos Sr. and the restoration of democracy in the Philippines.

name: Ratification of the 1987 Constitution
description: A new constitution was ratified, establishing the democratic framework of the current Philippine government.

name: Mount Pinatubo Eruption
description: The eruption of Mount Pinatubo caused massive destruction, displacing thousands and impacting global weather patterns.

name: Second EDSA Revolution
description: The Second People Power Revolution led to the resignation of President Joseph Estrada and the assumption of power by Gloria Macapagal Arroyo.

name: Typhoon Haiyan (Yolanda)
description: Typhoon Haiyan, one of the strongest tropical cyclones ever recorded, devastated the central Philippines, killing thousands and leaving millions homeless.

name: Marawi Siege
description: The battle between government forces and Islamist militants in Marawi led to the destruction of much of the city and the displacement of thousands.

name: COVID-19 Pandemic in the Philippines
description: The COVID-19 pandemic severely impacted the Philippines, resulting in widespread lockdowns, economic downturn, and healthcare challenges.

name: Ferdinand Marcos Sr. Jr. Elected President
description: Ferdinand Marcos Sr. Jr. was elected as the 17th president of the Philippines, marking the return of the Marcos family to the highest political office.

name: End of COVID-19 Emergency
description: On July 21, President Ferdinand Marcos Sr. Jr. declared the end of the COVID-19 emergency in the Philippines.
